text: Hello. I hope you are well today. I am wondering if you regularly give to charity?
Yes I do. I find it very fulfilling to give back
I agree with you on that. I am just now watching the news about the hurricane in Hawaii and seeing the damage already done.
It is very scary to think about. Not only are they ravaged by the volcano, now a hurricane.
I know. I actually have family living there. The rains over the past two days have been awful.
I am curious what we can do to help.
I have been looking into ways to help. I see that an organization called Save the Children is already mobilizing to help.
Do you know anything about how they are helping the children?
They have an emergency response team ready to go. They are preparing child-specific and focused supplies in case they are needed. They are in touch with officials in Hawaii.
That's really awesome, are they more in need of supplies or monetary donations?
Definitely more in need of monetary donations. They are asking people to donate to their emergency fund.
Do they have a donation tier level? I want to help out as much as I can.
If you are willing, you can actually donate from your payment from this hit!
Really? What forms of payments are accepted?/
They can deduct directly from your payment from this task.
That is nice. But I would like to give more than a measly $2. Is there another way to donate?/
How nice of you. Yes, I can give you that information, but would you like to start with donating part or all of your payment for this hit?
I would like to keep the payment for this HIT. This goes into a different fund. But I would like to be able $150 to this charity.

Wow! That is very generous. I am still thinking, though, that the small donations made from these hits are so easy to donate and can really add up if we all pitch in together! You can even just give a very small portion of your compensation from this hit.
I can donate the .30 base payment but I am still very curious on donating outside the HIT.
Thank you so much. Your .30 will be greatly appreciated by Save the Children. Go to  URL to learn more an donate! Thank you for your generosity!
